description.S1: Ludwig Miller, a guard watching over the landing pad south of Edgewater,
description.S2: is convinced that automechanicals are planning to wipe out humanity.
description.S3: He's asked you to help him wage a secret war against the mechanical menace.

blurb.B1: The quest is started by speaking to Ludwig Miller near the entrance of the Edgewater landing pad and agreeing to join the resistance against the automechanicals.
blurb.B2: With a Persuade 5 check, one can convince him to pay an upfront enlistment fee of 75 bits.
blurb.B3: Ludwig's first task is to destroy a damaged mechanical sentry located at the Edgewater junkyard.
blurb.B4: Miller claims it is a scout for the automechanicals at the geothermal power plant.

description.S1: Ludwig reports that he's spotted a forward scout of the mechanical arm north of the landing pad.
description.S2: As a test of your mettle,
description.S3: he's requested that you dispose of this scout in the name of humanity.

blurb.B1: The automechanical scout isn't hostile when it is approached.
blurb.B2: It can either be destroyed per Ludwig's request or repaired,
blurb.B3: as it is only roaming the junkyard because its navigation systems are damaged.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Thank the Law. I've been requisitioning backup for months. Guess the boss finally came to his senses.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: You ever swung a truncheon? Let me see your rifling stance. I wanna make sure you're up to snuff.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are you babbling about?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Are you okay? You seem confused.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If your Resistance needs another gun, I am for hire.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll let you be.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: The war! The coming apocalypse. Man versus machine.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm talking about mechanicals, soldier. Cold, heartless automatons made of iron and lies.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Uh. Yeah. Gotta watch out for those mechanicals.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's right. That's what I been saying. We gotta square our shoulders and stand ever vigilant.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Au. To. Mechanicals. Creatures forged in the fires of malevolence. I seen them over by the old power plant. Clattering about. Firing at the birds. Orchestrating their uprising.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: When the swarms of mechanicals come clanging on over that hill, where will you be? Cowering beneath your cot? Or standing shoulder to shoulder with the Resistance?

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: I been gathering up a war chest over the years. Saltuna cans, mostly. Some Spacer's Chaw. Few bit carts. I'll reward you for your aid.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Proper armies pay enlistment fees.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What do you need done?

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Enlistment fees? Yeah, I suppose. Wouldn't want to give the Resistance a bad name.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: They have sent a scout. Prowling around the junkyard, just behind our beloved town.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: This scout must not be permitted to return to its base of operations. Cross it off, then report back.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If I'm going after this mechanical scout, I could use a couple pointers.

dialog.speaker: LudwigMiller (Male)
dialog.utterance: Mechanicals got a weak spot in their midsections. I think the technical term is uh - the blue glowy square thing.
